title: Verizon beats estimates as it adds more postpaid users
text:
Verizon Communications beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue on Friday, as the largest U.S. wireless carrier by subscribers signed up more mobile phone customers who pay a monthly bill.

The company's strategy of focusing on the core wireless business has often been contrasted with that of AT&T, its next largest competitor, which has invested in media content to grow the company.

Meanwhile, rivals T-Mobile US and Sprint have been locked in a lengthy merger process.

Verizon in the quarter launched four new pricing plans for its unlimited packages starting from $35, in a strong push to add more subscribers.

The company is also preparing to roll out 5G in more than 17 cities by the end of the year, as wireless carriers seek to expand aggressively to dominate a mobile technology that promises movie downloads in a few seconds.

By 2021, the number of 5G connections is forecast to reach between 20 million and 100 million, according to research firm Statista.
description: Verizon beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue on Friday, as it signed up more phone customers who pay a monthly bill.
